org.ggp.base.apps.utilities

Class SimpleGameSim

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ggp.base.apps.utilities.SimpleGameSim

  • public class SimpleGameSim
extends java.lang.Object
    SimpleGameSim is a utility program that lets you simulate play through a given game, and see which propositions become true/false in each state as the game is played. This can be used to understand how a game runs, or to debug issues in the state machine implementation. It can also hide the step counter / control proposition, though this is done in a very naive way, by just looking for (step ?x) and (control ?x) propositions. None the less, it's still useful to have.
    Author:
    Sam Schreiber
